view

Class ReservationView

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.View
      • view.ReservationView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.TableModelListener

    public class ReservationView
extends View
    This class is a subclass to view and draws the reservation type of view. It therefore extends View
    Author:
    Michael Søby Andersen, msoa@itu.dk

      • draw

        public javax.swing.JPanel draw()
        Method draw This method draws the entire view for reservations. It overrides the superclass draw but also calls this. It draws the table, the buttons and everything else
        Overrides:
        draw in class View
        Returns:
        JPanel The panel that contains the entire view

      • graphical

        public void graphical(boolean graphical)
        Method graphical This method sets the boolean for graphical, and reloads the view
        Parameters:
        graphical - Whether or not graphical or textual should be selected

      • parseObjects

        public java.lang.Object[][] parseObjects(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Reservation> dataObjects,
                                int id)
        Method parseObjects This method takes a hashmap containing the reservations, and converts it to a 2d-array that is required to make a table. It either only takes the customers defined by id, or all if id is -1
        Parameters:
        dataObjects - The hashmap containing reservations
        id - The id of the customer, -1 for all
        Returns:
        Object[][] The 2d-array that the table requires

      • addEntry

        public boolean addEntry(java.lang.Object[] input)
        Method addEntry This method adds an entry to the database, and if successfull adds it to the table aswell. If not successfull it displays a message, and returns false
        Overrides:
        addEntry in class View
        Parameters:
        input - The input fields from add form
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not it has been successful

      • changeCustomer

                  int newCustomer)

        Parameters:

        newCustomer - The customer to change to

      • changeType

              int newType)

      • removeReservation

        public void removeReservation(int rowID,
                     javax.swing.JTable table)
        Method removeReservation This method removes a reservation. On success it removes it from the table aswell. On fail it displays a messagebox
        Parameters:
        rowID - The row to be removed
        table - The table to remove from

      • changeReservation

        public void changeReservation(int rowID,
                     int columnID,
                     javax.swing.JTable table)
        Method changeReservation This method changes a reservation. On fail it displays a messagebox and reverts the field to the original content
        Parameters:
        rowID - The row that has been changed
        columnID - The column that has been changed
        table - The table that has been changed

      • createButtons

        public javax.swing.JPanel createButtons()
        Method createButtons This method creates the buttons specific for reservation view. It puts them in a JPanel and return that. It also adds actionlisteners to them Overrides super createButtons and calls this
        Overrides:
        createButtons in class View
        Returns:
        JPanel The panel containing the buttons

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Method mouseClicked This method is called whenever the table is clicked. It checks what has been clicked and calls the appropriate method. Either remove reservation or change customer/type
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
